title.value: Эффективность азотных и борных удобрений при возделывании сои на супесчаной почве в южной части Беларуси
Efficiency of nitrogen and boron fertilizers in soybean cultivation on sandy loam soil in the southern part of Belarus

journal.title: Agriculture and Plant Protection : scientific-practical journal

person.name: Tatarina, M.V., Polesye Institute for Plant Growing (Belarus)
Khaletski, V.N., National Academy of Sciences, Minsk (Belarus). Brest Regional Agricultural Experimental Station

abstract.value: In the conditions of the Republic of Belarus in conducting research on sod-podzolic sandy loam soils it was found that the use of mineral nitrogen (N30) with a top dressing of boric acid (0,5 kg per ha) allowed to increase soybean (Glycine max) yields by an average of two years to 3,7 tons per ha. The purpose of the realized investigation was to determine the norms and terms of applying nitrogen fertilizers and their effects on soybean yield. Nitrogen fertilizer had a positive effect on field germination rate of soybean for all the options of fertilizers, but the highest germinating capacity provided variants with preplanting application of nitrogen - 85-86%. Nitrogen fertilizers in different doses and at different times had a significant impact on the dynamics of the linear structure of plants and soybean yield. The maximum yield obtained by feeding high doses of nitrogen (N60) in combination with boric acid (0,5 kg per ha) on average for two years – 16,7 hundreds kilograms per hectare. However, the most high economic efficiency achieved in the variant with fertilizing with nitrogen (N30) and boric acid (0,5 kg per ha) – 42,3% return in the cultivation of grain, or 58,9% in the production of seeds of the 'elite'.
